text: Regarding the list of use cases Jeremy posted at  <https://github.com/hyperledger/hyperledger/wiki/Identity-WG---Use-Cases-Inventory>, it seems to me that some good next steps would be: 1) add some more detail to each of these use cases, particularly with regard to what requirements each use case places on identity 2) arrive at a consolidated and somewhat prioritized list of requirements for identity from #1.   Thoughts?  Or maybe the requirements are clear to others from these use cases?

attachments.title: hyperledger/hyperledger
attachments.text: Hyperledger Project is a new Collaborative Project at The Linux Foundation. The technical community is just getting started and will be adding code to the repository in the coming weeks. Check hype...

text:
Our next bi-weekly Identity WG call is this Wednesday, at 9am PT (noon ET). WebEx at <https://meetings.webex.com/collabs/meetings/join?uuid=M13E85PQ13KWSMVJJLZ1FZ3XNX-9VIB>
or join by phone <tel:+1-408-525-6800|+1-408-525-6800> Call-in toll number (US/Canada) <tel:+1-866-432-9903|+1-866-432-9903> Meeting number: 190 609 401
The agenda for the next meeting is for IBM’s Membership Services team to present their updated slides on the identity architecture used in Fabric.
